content.description: Hard start left of ledge(until right side is cleaned). Move through sweet laybacks on positive holds and decent feet throughout. Continue this movement to the top of a slightly dirty gulley.
content.protection: Probably finger to hand sized gear. Ample gear placements throughout. TR same as "Butter Finger"

content.description: Starts in a shallow depression with some intricate beginning moves. Move up through a short, featured arete into the first crux, a single finger pocket/crack type feature. The crux was skipped for now, but the line finished straight up. Finish with some more hard moves on some classic sandstone type crack features to the top of a deadly looking (but surprisingly solid) pointy block.
content.protection: TR. Good tree, nut and #3 cam placement. 30 ft cordelette did the trick
content.location: Follow access trail for a few hundred feet. As it bends right, swing left. Follow cliff line for a few hundred yards. Climb is just left of a diagonal dihedral crack.

content.description: This cave has a massive 30 foot roof with a crack down the center. The majority of the climbs are not in this cave, but rather to the left and right of the cave.
